thread.title: Ground News - TIMELINE: Severe storms brings risk of hail, tornadoes to Oklahoma on Sunday
thread.title_full: Ground News - TIMELINE: Severe storms brings risk of hail, tornadoes to Oklahoma on Sunday

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - TIMELINE: Severe storms brings risk of hail, tornadoes to Oklahoma on Sunday
text:
Summary by Ground News KOCO 5 Meteorologist Jonathan Conder says central Oklahoma, including the OKC metro, to parts of western Oklahoma near Clinton, Hobart and Woodward, have a level-two slight risk for storms on Sunday. The concern will be for damaging winds, hail and a tornado risk. The biggest threat is for 1.75-inch hail and 60 mph winds. Share menu 0 Articles 0 Articles All Left Center Right
Koco News5 Center High Factuality Media Conglomerate: Hearst Communications TIMELINE: Severe storms brings risk of hail, tornadoes to Oklahoma on Sunday While some may see some rain on Friday, we have a Red Panel Alert Day on Sunday as severe storms move back into Oklahoma.
10 hours ago · Sacramento, United States Read Full Article
